title: Jean Bène
text:
Jean Bène (12 July 1901 – 26 April 1992) was a lifelong politician in <a href="France">France</a> and a leader in the <a href="French%20Resistance">French Resistance</a>.
Bène was born in <a href="P%C3%A9zenas">Pézenas</a>, <a href="H%C3%A9rault">Hérault</a>. Initially a lawyer, he turned to politics. He was a member of the <a href="Socialist%20Party%20%28France%29">Parti Socialiste</a> in the <a href="Section%20fran%C3%A7aise%20de%20l%27Internationale%20ouvri%C3%A8re">SFIO</a>. Bène was <a href="Municipal%20council%23France">conseiller municipal</a> of Pézenas in 1929, then mayor in 1931. He was recalled by the <a href="Vichy%20regime">Vichy regime</a>.
He involved himself in the <a href="French%20resistance">resistance</a> and created the <a href="Maquis%20la%20Tourette">La Tourette</a> maquis, one of the <a href="Maquis%20%28World%20War%20II%29">maquis</a> networks of resistance fighters, in the <a href="Communes%20of%20France">commune</a> of <a href="Ferri%C3%A8res-Poussarou">Ferrières-Poussarou</a>. For this he would be decorated with the <a href="L%C3%A9gion%20d%27honneur">Légion d'honneur</a>, the <a href="Croix%20de%20guerre%201939-1945">Croix de guerre</a> and the <a href="m%C3%A9daille%20de%20la%20R%C3%A9sistance">médaille de la Résistance</a>.
He returned to the mayorship of Pézenas from 1945 to 1947 and then from 1953 to 1977. In 1945 he became president of the <a href="General%20council%20%28France%29">conseil général</a> of the <a href="H%C3%A9rault">Hérault</a>, and continued in this role until 1979. He was <a href="Senate%20of%20France">senator</a> for the Hérault from 1959 until 1971, during which he was on the commissions for foreign affairs, for defense and for the armed forces.
The "collège de Pézenas" is named in his honour.
